result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody James Schumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg. Sex. Assault/Unconscious Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $770 to Crime Victim Compensation
--to pay restitution in the amount of $50 to SMZ 

The Court does authorize the Prison to take restitution and court costs from Mr. Schumann's Prison wages and accounts.

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--comply with all treatment recommendations related to mental health diagnosis
--take all medications only as prescribed
--sexual offender evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--comply with all sex offender reporting and registration requirements
--no contact with SMZ (dob 5/1/1986)
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:37pm [mo]
Defendant Cody James Schumann in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Svehlek requests a short adjournment; gives basis
--ADA Teuber objects the request for adjournment; gives basis
--The Court denies the request to adjourn; gives basis

ADA Teuber submits Victim Impact Statement and Request for Restitution to the Court

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Schumann   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Schumann

The Court sentences Mr. Schumann to  15  years of Imprisonment , with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  8  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 7  years &    0 months.  This sentence is to commence  FORTHWITH.

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives  1   day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--comply with all treatment recommendations related to mental health diagnosis
--take all medications only as prescribed
--sexual offender evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--comply with all sex offender reporting and registration requirements
--no contact with SMZ (dob 5/1/1986)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $770 to Crime Victim Compensation
--to pay restitution in the amount of $50 to SMZ 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

The Court does authorize the Prison to take restitution and court costs from Mr. Schumann's Prison wages and accounts.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 2:13pm

Case called at 11:21 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Cody James Schumann in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Requests matter be set for plea/sentencing hearing in December, will be holding informal pre-trial with the assigned prosecutor prior to that date, but since
the case is significant, do believe need time requested
ADA Hall: No objection, assigned prosecutor is out-of-office for the next couple weeks, so December is good-timing
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Hall indicates that she is not aware of any bond issues
Court continues bond
Recess: 11:22 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing Hearing 12/10/15 at 1:30 pm (1 hour) - Send notices

Case called at 8:42 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Cody James Schumann in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Schumann
Recess: 8:43 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 9/9/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/9/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices
The Court concludes the request it timely and in the proper form.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:31am [mo]
Defendant Cody James Schumann in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Mr. Schumann waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

ADA Hall submits Information
Atty. Svehlek requests an Arraignment be scheduled at a later date.
recess: 8:36am

NEXT: Arraignment: 8/10/15 at 8:30am
Defendant is ordered to submit to testing
Proposed order submitted by the State

[MK] case called at 10:42am. 
Defendant Cody J Schumann in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance, indicating that the victim is present in the courtroom. 
After a discussion with counsel, the Court grants the State's Motion for HIV Testing.  The Court directs the State to include in its proposed order specifics as to what type of testing Mr. Schumann is expected to submit to, what testing/results are being ordered by the Court, and also the funding aspect of the testing.  
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that then-DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Schumann on a misdemeanor case in 2007. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess 10:51am.

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 7/27/15 at 8:30am.
Status conference on June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2015 at 10:20 am.

case called at 1:18pm. 
Defendant Cody James Schumann appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Zarwell indicates that Mr. Schumann is eligible for PD representation. 

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court confirms name, date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $25,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--No contact with S.M.Z dob 5/1/1986
--No presence at the residence of S.M.Z
--no acts or threats of violence
--no use of online dating services
recess 1:22 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on June 10, 2015 at 10:20am   (2) Status Conference on June 30, 2015 at 8:30am
